intro: Stillingia obtusifolia, commonly known as the blunt-leaved stillingia, is a perennial flowering plant native to eastern North America. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically ovate to elliptic in shape. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to orange, with a distinctive style that curves downward. Stillingia obtusifolia is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks.
